00052 class CUDT;

00054 struct CUnit
00055 {
00056    CPacket m_Packet;            // packet
00057    int m_iFlag;                 // 0: free, 1: occupied, 2: msg read but not freed (out-of-order), 3: msg dropped
00058 };
00059 
00060 class CUnitQueue
00061 {
00062 friend class CRcvQueue;
00063 friend class CRcvBuffer;
00064 
00065 public:
00066    CUnitQueue();
00067    ~CUnitQueue();
00068 
00069 public:
00070 
00071       // Functionality:
00072       //    Initialize the unit queue.
00073       // Parameters:
00074       //    1) [in] size: queue size
00075       //    2) [in] mss: maximum segament size
00076       //    3) [in] version: IP version
00077       // Returned value:
00078       //    0: success, -1: failure.
00079 
00080    int init(const int& size, const int& mss, const int& version);
00081 
00082       // Functionality:
00083       //    Increase (double) the unit queue size.
00084       // Parameters:
00085       //    None.
00086       // Returned value:
00087       //    0: success, -1: failure.
00088 
00089    int increase();
00090 
00091       // Functionality:
00092       //    Decrease (halve) the unit queue size.
00093       // Parameters:
00094       //    None.
00095       // Returned value:
00096       //    0: success, -1: failure.
00097 
00098    int shrink();
00099 
00100       // Functionality:
00101       //    find an available unit for incoming packet.
00102       // Parameters:
00103       //    None.
00104       // Returned value:
00105       //    Pointer to the available unit, NULL if not found.
00106 
00107    CUnit* getNextAvailUnit();
00108 
00109 private:
00110    struct CQEntry
00111    {
00112       CUnit* m_pUnit;           // unit queue
00113       char* m_pBuffer;          // data buffer
00114       int m_iSize;              // size of each queue
00115 
00116       CQEntry* m_pNext;
00117    }
00118    *m_pQEntry,                  // pointer to the first unit queue
00119    *m_pCurrQueue,               // pointer to the current available queue
00120    *m_pLastQueue;               // pointer to the last unit queue
00121 
00122    CUnit* m_pAvailUnit;         // recent available unit
00123 
00124    int m_iSize;                 // total size of the unit queue, in number of packets
00125    int m_iCount;                // total number of valid packets in the queue
00126 
00127    int m_iMSS;                  // unit buffer size
00128    int m_iIPversion;            // IP version
00129 
00130 private:
00131    CUnitQueue(const CUnitQueue&);
00132    CUnitQueue& operator=(const CUnitQueue&);
00133 };

00135 struct CSNode
00136 {
00137    CUDT* m_pUDT;                // Pointer to the instance of CUDT socket
00138    uint64_t m_llTimeStamp;      // Time Stamp
00139 
00140    int m_iHeapLoc;              // location on the heap, -1 means not on the heap
00141 };

00143 class CSndUList
00144 {
00145 friend class CSndQueue;
00146 
00147 public:
00148    CSndUList();
00149    ~CSndUList();
00150 
00151 public:
00152 
00153       // Functionality:
00154       //    Insert a new UDT instance into the list.
00155       // Parameters:
00156       //    1) [in] ts: time stamp: next processing time
00157       //    2) [in] u: pointer to the UDT instance
00158       // Returned value:
00159       //    None.
00160 
00161    void insert(const int64_t& ts, const CUDT* u);
00162 
00163       // Functionality:
00164       //    Update the timestamp of the UDT instance on the list.
00165       // Parameters:
00166       //    1) [in] u: pointer to the UDT instance
00167       //    2) [in] resechedule: if the timestampe shoudl be rescheduled
00168       // Returned value:
00169       //    None.
00170 
00171    void update(const CUDT* u, const bool& reschedule = true);
00172 
00173       // Functionality:
00174       //    Retrieve the next packet and peer address from the first entry, and reschedule it in the queue.
00175       // Parameters:
00176       //    0) [out] addr: destination address of the next packet
00177       //    1) [out] pkt: the next packet to be sent
00178       // Returned value:
00179       //    1 if successfully retrieved, -1 if no packet found.
00180 
00181    int pop(sockaddr*& addr, CPacket& pkt);
00182 
00183       // Functionality:
00184       //    Remove UDT instance from the list.
00185       // Parameters:
00186       //    1) [in] u: pointer to the UDT instance
00187       // Returned value:
00188       //    None.
00189 
00190    void remove(const CUDT* u);
00191 
00192       // Functionality:
00193       //    Retrieve the next scheduled processing time.
00194       // Parameters:
00195       //    None.
00196       // Returned value:
00197       //    Scheduled processing time of the first UDT socket in the list.
00198 
00199    uint64_t getNextProcTime();
00200 
00201 private:
00202    void insert_(const int64_t& ts, const CUDT* u);
00203    void remove_(const CUDT* u);
00204 
00205 private:
00206    CSNode** m_pHeap;                    // The heap array
00207    int m_iArrayLength;                  // physical length of the array
00208    int m_iLastEntry;                    // position of last entry on the heap array
00209 
00210    pthread_mutex_t m_ListLock;
00211 
00212    pthread_mutex_t* m_pWindowLock;
00213    pthread_cond_t* m_pWindowCond;
00214 
00215    CTimer* m_pTimer;
00216 
00217 private:
00218    CSndUList(const CSndUList&);
00219    CSndUList& operator=(const CSndUList&);
00220 };
00221 
00222 struct CRNode
00223 {
00224    CUDT* m_pUDT;                // Pointer to the instance of CUDT socket
00225    uint64_t m_llTimeStamp;      // Time Stamp
00226 
00227    CRNode* m_pPrev;             // previous link
00228    CRNode* m_pNext;             // next link
00229 
00230    bool m_bOnList;              // if the node is already on the list
00231 };

00233 class CRcvUList
00234 {
00235 public:
00236    CRcvUList();
00237    ~CRcvUList();
00238 
00239 public:
00240 
00241       // Functionality:
00242       //    Insert a new UDT instance to the list.
00243       // Parameters:
00244       //    1) [in] u: pointer to the UDT instance
00245       // Returned value:
00246       //    None.
00247 
00248    void insert(const CUDT* u);
00249 
00250       // Functionality:
00251       //    Remove the UDT instance from the list.
00252       // Parameters:
00253       //    1) [in] u: pointer to the UDT instance
00254       // Returned value:
00255       //    None.
00256 
00257    void remove(const CUDT* u);
00258 
00259       // Functionality:
00260       //    Move the UDT instance to the end of the list, if it already exists; otherwise, do nothing.
00261       // Parameters:
00262       //    1) [in] u: pointer to the UDT instance
00263       // Returned value:
00264       //    None.
00265 
00266    void update(const CUDT* u);
00267 
00268 public:
00269    CRNode* m_pUList;            // the head node
00270 
00271 private:
00272    CRNode* m_pLast;             // the last node
00273 
00274 private:
00275    CRcvUList(const CRcvUList&);
00276    CRcvUList& operator=(const CRcvUList&);
00277 };

00279 class CHash
00280 {
00281 public:
00282    CHash();
00283    ~CHash();
00284 
00285 public:
00286 
00287       // Functionality:
00288       //    Initialize the hash table.
00289       // Parameters:
00290       //    1) [in] size: hash table size
00291       // Returned value:
00292       //    None.
00293 
00294    void init(const int& size);
00295 
00296       // Functionality:
00297       //    Look for a UDT instance from the hash table.
00298       // Parameters:
00299       //    1) [in] id: socket ID
00300       // Returned value:
00301       //    Pointer to a UDT instance, or NULL if not found.
00302 
00303    CUDT* lookup(const int32_t& id);
00304 
00305       // Functionality:
00306       //    Insert an entry to the hash table.
00307       // Parameters:
00308       //    1) [in] id: socket ID
00309       //    2) [in] u: pointer to the UDT instance
00310       // Returned value:
00311       //    None.
00312 
00313    void insert(const int32_t& id, const CUDT* u);
00314 
00315       // Functionality:
00316       //    Remove an entry from the hash table.
00317       // Parameters:
00318       //    1) [in] id: socket ID
00319       // Returned value:
00320       //    None.
00321 
00322    void remove(const int32_t& id);
00323 
00324 private:
00325    struct CBucket
00326    {
00327       int32_t m_iID;            // Socket ID
00328       CUDT* m_pUDT;             // Socket instance
00329 
00330       CBucket* m_pNext;         // next bucket
00331    } **m_pBucket;               // list of buckets (the hash table)
00332 
00333    int m_iHashSize;             // size of hash table
00334 
00335 private:
00336    CHash(const CHash&);
00337    CHash& operator=(const CHash&);
00338 };

00363 class CSndQueue
00364 {
00365 friend class CUDT;
00366 friend class CUDTUnited;
00367 
00368 public:
00369    CSndQueue();
00370    ~CSndQueue();
00371 
00372 public:
00373 
00374       // Functionality:
00375       //    Initialize the sending queue.
00376       // Parameters:
00377       //    1) [in] c: UDP channel to be associated to the queue
00378       //    2) [in] t: Timer
00379       // Returned value:
00380       //    None.
00381 
00382    void init(const CChannel* c, const CTimer* t);
00383 
00384       // Functionality:
00385       //    Send out a packet to a given address.
00386       // Parameters:
00387       //    1) [in] addr: destination address
00388       //    2) [in] packet: packet to be sent out
00389       // Returned value:
00390       //    Size of data sent out.
00391 
00392    int sendto(const sockaddr* addr, CPacket& packet);
00393 
00394 private:
00395 #ifndef WIN32
00396    static void* worker(void* param);
00397 #else
00398    static DWORD WINAPI worker(LPVOID param);
00399 #endif
00400 
00401    pthread_t m_WorkerThread;
00402 
00403 private:
00404    CSndUList* m_pSndUList;              // List of UDT instances for data sending
00405    CChannel* m_pChannel;                // The UDP channel for data sending
00406    CTimer* m_pTimer;                    // Timing facility
00407 
00408    pthread_mutex_t m_WindowLock;
00409    pthread_cond_t m_WindowCond;
00410 
00411    volatile bool m_bClosing;            // closing the worker
00412    pthread_cond_t m_ExitCond;
00413 
00414 private:
00415    CSndQueue(const CSndQueue&);
00416    CSndQueue& operator=(const CSndQueue&);
00417 };

00419 class CRcvQueue
00420 {
00421 friend class CUDT;
00422 friend class CUDTUnited;
00423 
00424 public:
00425    CRcvQueue();
00426    ~CRcvQueue();
00427 
00428 public:
00429 
00430       // Functionality:
00431       //    Initialize the receiving queue.
00432       // Parameters:
00433       //    1) [in] size: queue size
00434       //    2) [in] mss: maximum packet size
00435       //    3) [in] version: IP version
00436       //    4) [in] hsize: hash table size
00437       //    5) [in] c: UDP channel to be associated to the queue
00438       //    6) [in] t: timer
00439       // Returned value:
00440       //    None.
00441 
00442    void init(const int& size, const int& payload, const int& version, const int& hsize, const CChannel* c, const CTimer* t);
00443 
00444       // Functionality:
00445       //    Read a packet for a specific UDT socket id.
00446       // Parameters:
00447       //    1) [in] id: Socket ID
00448       //    2) [out] packet: received packet
00449       // Returned value:
00450       //    Data size of the packet
00451 
00452    int recvfrom(const int32_t& id, CPacket& packet);
00453 
00454 private:
00455 #ifndef WIN32
00456    static void* worker(void* param);
00457 #else
00458    static DWORD WINAPI worker(LPVOID param);
00459 #endif
00460 
00461    pthread_t m_WorkerThread;
00462 
00463 private:
00464    CUnitQueue m_UnitQueue;              // The received packet queue
00465 
00466    CRcvUList* m_pRcvUList;              // List of UDT instances that will read packets from the queue
00467    CHash* m_pHash;                      // Hash table for UDT socket looking up
00468    CChannel* m_pChannel;                // UDP channel for receving packets
00469    CTimer* m_pTimer;                    // shared timer with the snd queue
00470 
00471    int m_iPayloadSize;                  // packet payload size
00472 
00473    volatile bool m_bClosing;            // closing the workder
00474    pthread_cond_t m_ExitCond;
00475 
00476 private:
00477    int setListener(const CUDT* u);
00478    void removeListener(const CUDT* u);
00479 
00480    void setNewEntry(CUDT* u);
00481    bool ifNewEntry();
00482    CUDT* getNewEntry();
00483 
00484    void storePkt(const int32_t& id, CPacket* pkt);
00485 
00486 private:
00487    pthread_mutex_t m_LSLock;
00488    volatile CUDT* m_pListener;                          // pointer to the (unique, if any) listening UDT entity
00489    CRendezvousQueue* m_pRendezvousQueue;                // The list of sockets in rendezvous mode
00490 
00491    std::vector<CUDT*> m_vNewEntry;                      // newly added entries, to be inserted
00492    pthread_mutex_t m_IDLock;
00493 
00494    std::map<int32_t, std::queue<CPacket*> > m_mBuffer;  // temporary buffer for rendezvous connection request
00495    pthread_mutex_t m_PassLock;
00496    pthread_cond_t m_PassCond;
00497 
00498 private:
00499    CRcvQueue(const CRcvQueue&);
00500    CRcvQueue& operator=(const CRcvQueue&);
00501 };

00503 struct CMultiplexer
00504 {
00505    CSndQueue* m_pSndQueue;      // The sending queue
00506    CRcvQueue* m_pRcvQueue;      // The receiving queue
00507    CChannel* m_pChannel;        // The UDP channel for sending and receiving
00508    CTimer* m_pTimer;            // The timer
00509 
00510    int m_iPort;                 // The UDP port number of this multiplexer
00511    int m_iIPversion;            // IP version
00512    int m_iMSS;                  // Maximum Segment Size
00513    int m_iRefCount;             // number of UDT instances that are associated with this multiplexer
00514    bool m_bReusable;            // if this one can be shared with others
00515 
00516    int m_iID;                   // multiplexer ID
00517 };
